rename.from: [BUG] old CI/CD checks still showing in the summary
rename.to: [BUG] old CI/CD checks still showing in the GitHub CI summary

issue.title: [BUG] readthedocs builds failing since 1620

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Readthedocs builds are now failing on all PR.

It seems the first occurrence of that was #1620.

In the GitHub checks display, it does not show as failing, but (indefinitely) as running, but the logs say failure.
Re display of checks, also see #1918.

body: The config file for appveyor has been removed in #1620 so it seems that the integration needs to be terminated from the appveyor, which is currently configured using an account that belongs to @mloning.
Also this https://github.community/t/removed-workflow-showing-up-as-check-for-pr/16393 I don't have the access so someone else needs to own this.

>Also this https://github.community/t/removed-workflow-showing-up-as-check-for-pr/16393 I don't have the access so someone else needs to own this.

Yes, this was it, @lmmentel!
It was coming from the branch protection rules.

This leads to required tests being *displayed* even if they are not *executed*.

I changed the required tests to the new ones, that should take care of the issue for all future PR (also of the appveyor one, I think).
ok, this apparently fixes GitHub actions, but not appveyor.
as @mloning said on slack, he probably just needs to delete (or uncouple) the appveyor project
I now deleted the appveyor project, hope that fixes it.

> I now deleted the appveyor project, hope that fixes it.

Excellent, it does! Thanks!
